newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: North Koreans take Southerners hostage--Seoul TV.
newsitem.headline: North Koreans take Southerners hostage--Seoul TV.

text.p: Two North Korean infiltrators have taken two South Koreans hostage in an east coast area close to where a North Korean submarine put ashore 26 agents last month, South Korean state television reported.

Local residents reported that two people picking mushrooms on a mountain in the area had been missing since Tuesday and a search revealed they had been taken hostage, the Korea Broadcasting System reported.
The television station said there was now a stand-off between the North Koreans and Southern troops.
No further details were given, and a defence ministry spokesman in the east coast city of Kangnung said he could not confirm the report.
Of the 26 North Korean agents who came ashore, 22 have been killed or found dead and one has been captured alive. A search has been under way for the remaining three.
